page.title: 14Maggie's Hoosie, Fraserburgh
page.content: Maggie's Hoosie is in Cairnbulg, near Fraserburgh. It is very old. It is a traditional fisher's cottage which is going to ruins. Some people want to knock it down. The Banff & Buchan District Council has to spend Â£l0,000 to have it restored. It has no water, no sanitation, no gas and no electricity. Cars can't manoever beside the hoosie so a wall will be knocked down. It would cost Â£l,200 for wages for a caretaker to bring it up to tourism standard. It has a thatched roof. The earth floor has a peat fire on it and the fire is just lit on the floor. There is a crane from the wall that swings the kettle over the fire. Maggie's full name was Margaret Duthie.
